page.title: 07PUBLIC HALL & PLAYING FIELD
page.content: The Public Hall was built in 1930 and extended in 1980 by voluntary labour. Members of the Coham-Fleming family laid both foundation stones. Inside there is a main dance hall with a stage, a dressing room and a kitchen. The hall is used for dances, plays and badminton, and the kitchen for table tennis, meetings and as a bar and tea room. Adjacent to the hall is the playing field.There are two gates,an asphalted children's playground with swings, see-saw, sand pit and roundabout, and 3 acres of mown grass. There is a toilet and bus shelter. The grassed area is used for cricket, football and as a general public amenity. The school is opposite and uses it for games lessons. The field is owned by the Parish Council and mown by the young people of the village.
